content: {{knowledge objective |Identifiant=OIC-237-08-B |Item_parent=Palpitations |Item_parent_short=Palpitations |Rank=B |Title=Identifying Wolff Parkinson White |Description=ECG diagnosis |Rubric=Etiologies |Contributors=Arnaud Bisson |Order=8}} * Presence of an '''atrio-ventricular accessory pathway'' connecting the atria to the ventricles (Kent's bundle) '''responsible for junctional tachycardias.''' * ECG manifestations: ventricular pre-excitation is evoked in sinus rhythm in the presence of the triad: ** '''Short PR''' (<120ms) ** wide QRS ** QRS initial phase thickening (''delta wave'' (δ)) [[File:Ventricular pre-excitation.png|centric|vignette|900x900px|ECG inter critical revealing a short PR interval and a delta wave]]

question.question: What is the characteristic ECG finding in a patient with Wolff-Parkinson-White syndrome?
question.option_a: Prolonged PR interval and narrow QRS
question.option_b: Short PR interval, wide QRS, and delta wave
question.option_c: Narrow QRS and absence of delta wave
question.option_d: Prolonged QRS and absence of delta wave
